oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Star Bakery Delivery Wagon with Driver and Horses
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 4 x 5 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten on envelope: "#200 Star Delivery Wagon." On back of photograph: "#200 Star Bakery Delivery Wagon, C. 1915, Donor Mrs. Sam Roscoe (Jeff-son) 377-4842."

Two horses pull the Star Bakery delivery wagon and the driver leans out the side. The words ''Rye Bread'' and ''2744 W. Colfax'' appear on the side of the wagon with the Jewish star symbol. The Star Bakery was founded by Jacob Boscowitz and was later owned by his sons, Rudy and Sam Boscoe.
Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, page 40.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Leather Notebook With Symptoms and Treatments
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicine
Jews
Medical instruments and apparatus
Esserman, Arthur,--1898-1952
Notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten label on interior reads: ''A.L. Esserman; 1595 Gilpin; Denver, COLO.''

A black leather notebook with six metal rings inside having an appearance of an address book, but used as a way to categorize symptoms and medical treatments. The back cover has flap and several medical charts and treatments are inside. There is a handwritten label inside: ''A.L. Esserman; 1595 Gilpin; Denver, COLO.'' Dr. Arthur L. Esserman (born 1898) was an intern at Children's Hospital in Denver, Colorado from 1924 to 1926 and practiced pediatric medicine in Denver from 1926 to 1952.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Arthur L. Esserman, M.D. Medical Equipment and Papers, Medical Equipment

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Square dancing
Periodicals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The California Magazine of Western Square and Round Dancing by the Square Dancers of Southern California. This edition includes the articles entitled "Pappy's Kids", "Forming A Square Dance Club?", "A New Introduction", "The Younger Set", "What Lies Ahead", "Country Dancing Comes To The City", and "Hints On The Care And Feeding Of Floors". This edition also includes the monthly articles entitled "On the Record", "The Square of the Month" and "Idea Corral". Located in the back of the issue is a "Southern California Square Dance Directory", "News From Other Parts of the Country" and "Schedule of Events for November".
